DataElement.preferredName: Smoking PATH Smokeless Tobacco Risk Perception Questionnaire 2 Use Harmfulness Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they?ve quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time._Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._A set of descriptors to assess the relative perceived harmfulness of something.

Property.preferredName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study Smokeless Tobacco Risk Perception Questionnaire Use
Property.preferredDefinition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.:Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.:A predetermined set of questions.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.longName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study
Concepts.definition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.
Tobacco that is not smoked but used in another form such as chewing tobacco or snuff.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
